sources.data_found: Palmetto 2 statistics: 1,206 compute nodes and 1,615 GPUs total.
5 new AI/ML nodes added to Palmetto 2; each node has 8x NVIDIA H100 80G GPUs (Dell PowerEdge XE9680).
Palmetto 2 includes specialized AI/ML nodes with 8-way NVLINK H100 or H200 GPUs for a total of 80 Hopper GPUs.
40 new nodes added to Palmetto; each node has 2x NVIDIA A100 GPUs.
GPU model codes listed as available on Palmetto 2: H200, H100, L40S, A40, A100, V100S, V100, P100, K40, K20; also notes A100 exists in both 80GB and 40GB variants.

student_data.notes: Searched in the requested order for Clemson CS enrollment counts specifically labeled Fall 2024 or AY 2024-2025. Found Clemson OIR’s Data and Reports page listing (a) CommonDataSet 2024-2025 and (b) 2024 Fact Sheet hosted on Clemson Box, but the Box viewer requires JavaScript and did not provide accessible PDF content in this environment. Attempted to retrieve the same documents via open.clemson.edu (Digital Commons) download links, but the PDF endpoints returned 403 Forbidden. Attempted to access the Clemson Interactive Factbook backend link (oirweb.app.clemson.edu/factbook) referenced by OIR pages, but it returned 502 Bad Gateway. Also located an unofficial School of Computing history page with CS enrollments, but it was Fall 2022 (rejected per requirement). Because no accessible source explicitly stating Fall 2024 or AY 2024-2025 CS enrollment counts (undergrad, MS, PhD) could be verified, all counts are set to 0.

gpu_resources.notes: Clusters found with publicly stated GPU specs: Palmetto 2 (Clemson RCD). Total GPUs (Palmetto 2) taken as 1,615. Confirmed node-based counts: (1) H100 AI/ML nodes: 5 nodes × 8 H100/node = 40 H100 (treated as SXM/NVLINK due to XE9680 + 8-way NVLINK context). (2) Hopper total: 80 Hopper GPUs stated as H100 or H200 with 8-way NVLINK; assume these are 10 nodes × 8 GPUs/node = 80 total Hopper GPUs. Since 40 H100 are already explicitly described, infer remaining 40 are H200: 5 nodes × 8 H200/node = 40 H200. (3) A100 addition (Dec 2022): 40 nodes × 2 A100/node = 80 A100; VRAM variant not stated, assumed A100 40GB for accounting. Remaining GPUs after confirmed counts: 1,615 - (40 H100 + 40 H200 + 80 A100) = 1,455 GPUs not broken down by model in the accessible sources. Because the in-browser hardware table is JS-rendered and not extractable here, the remaining 1,455 are allocated as an estimate based on typical cluster upgrade timing and the documented availability of A100/V100/P100/L40S/A40/A6000: addl A100 40GB=720 (bringing a100_40gb to 800 total incl. the confirmed 80), A100 80GB=200, V100 family (V100+V100S)=350, P100=80, L40S=40, A40=40, A6000=25. Estimated-category totals + confirmed categories sum exactly to 1,615.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
